availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, student and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Reuben Sebree and Mary Sebree. Married to Louisa Church Sebree. Father of Ann Sebree. Attended school in Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned three enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1850. Attended school in Franklin County in 1860. Household owned five enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1860. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private from July 13, 1861 to July 17 1864. Reported as deserted on July 17, 1864.
